Reviews.Title: “in the heart of Playa”
Reviews.Author: Arleen D
Reviews.Content: I had a great time when visiting Playa and staying at In Fashion. My friends and I had no problems upon checking in and the rooms were very clean and very chic. Staff helpful. You get your value here. The hotel is located right in the heart of everything, right off of the famouse La quinta (5th Ave.) Where there are many restaurants and plenty of night clubs. Its the best place to stay in f you plan on having a good time and party at night! the best clubs are right on 12th. Plenty of restaurants and shopping along 5th ave. The beach is a short skip and jump from the hotel as well! The front desk people don't seem to know too much about the happenings in playa but they tried.... We would ask their opinionis on food and entertainment and alot of times the weren't too sure, but thats what Trip Advisor is here for!

Reviews.Title: “If you are a party animal-it's worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shiransoraya
Reviews.Content: My staying in the fashion boutique hotel was not bad, Just for to know, all the hotels/hostels/boutiques on the 5 ave. In playa del carmen are really old and I mean those one that the average night in 100$ and down. If you looking for hotel in 130$, that look chic with European style you find the right place: "Infashion boutique hotel". About the rooms: I'm speechless about the rooms. Although we took the petit suite it's not was so petit lol. . I just love it! All the designer furniture was incredible, the suit is big and comftable everything styling in white and with a liitle bitt of touchups of red. In one word-authentic!@&! I just want to mention that hotel is in front the "coco bongo" and the palazzo the famous clubs of playa So if you looking for quiet in the night- forget it! It's gonna be noisy. But if gonna be drunk you're gonna be just fine. There is a wifi in the rooms-really strong. The hotel is located in the perfect location of playa. All the best restaurants and clubs are under your nose. Everything in the hotel are new and impressive. So it's worth the money that you pay. I hope youl enjoy from your vacation. Adios:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Worth every cent.”
Reviews.Author: meeir8
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, in the city central. We recommending on the spa suit.

Reviews.Title: “Room Reservation”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel C
Reviews.Content: I reserved the master suite, when I arrived I have told that my master suite wasn't ready yet, I had to wait until 3:00 pm. At the end they gave me a junior suite because they didn't have the Master suite available, after my discussion with the front desk she just told me that they cannot do anything because they don't have that suite available, they offer me a massage but I chose this hotel because the master suite have a jacuzzi. I couldn't sleep, it was so noisy, people outsite and inside the hotel were screaming all night long. Worst hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “The Fashionable thing to do is check out”
Reviews.Author: Azimm
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotel experiences I've encountered. I was staying here to celebrate NYE 2012. We arrived, they didn't have my reservation. I of course had a copy which I had to email the lady on reception. I was given the last room. Lucky me...or so I thought. I had to go back to reception three times as the key didn't work (turned out I didn't need it anyway as all we had to do is push the door hard and it opened) For several hundred U.S Dollars you would perhaps expect a toilet seat? If the room has a plasma screen it would make sense to have a remote (don't bother calling reception for it thou as it will never arrive) I thought I might go to the gym to work of some steam, I asked for a Map of the area so I could get to gym. It was my first time in Playa Del Carmen and indeed Mexico. No maps. I was pointed in a direction and told it was about three blocks in that way. Some effort or more assistance would have been nice after a long flight. What they also failed to mention is that the club downstairs has music playing until the early hours, even with ear plugs the rumble of the bass can be felt through floors and deep into any nightmare. Thankfully me and my friends moved into an apartment first thing in the morn. Of course there were problems checking out, they apparently charged me $30 less then they should have. There was no way I was going to hand over any cash to the reception staff after the horrific hotel experience. They told me they would just charge the card used for a reservation. All I could think about was getting out of there. In Fashion hotel? Outta your mind. P.S I never did find the gym

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, luxurious room”
Reviews.Author: sonhomeu
Reviews.Content: Although it was New Year's and there was a DJ festival (which meant going to bed with loud music and even waking up to loud music still going in the morning!), this hotel was an overall great experience. The hotel is very modern and classy, and we loved our spotless room with an amazing bathroom, and the rooftop deck with view and pool. The staff was always very friendly, smiling and hospitable. The hotel is close to the beach and Quinta Avenida and every price range of restaurants imaginable....we ate lots of delicious Mexican food! We had a rental car and even found street parking without a problem. Unfortunately we booked a king and got a room with two double beds (apparently the hotel was sold out for New Year's weekend). Also, we were given breakfast tickets the first day (to a Brazilian restaurant around the corner with a delicious breakfast buffet with all sorts of options, both sweet and savory, Mexican and international, tropical fruits, etc., and we thought it was a one time thing - free breakfast). On our last day as we were heading out to see Tulum (pyramid site) early in the morning, the concierge asked if we wanted breakfast tickets. I asked why we weren't offered them everyday, or given them all at the beginning, and was told because people lose them. But nowhere did it say breakfast was included daily. Shame on us for not asking, but it would have been nice if somebody had told us just in case! So...if you book this place, make sure you know there is a rooftop area to hang out, that breakfast is included, you may not get the room you requested, and that it is not in a quiet area at all. If you want a beautiful, modern, well-located (to shopping, restaurants, the beach, nightlife, etc.) hotel though, this is a great one and we really enjoyed the experience and the place, despite the constant dance music and lack of communication by the staff as to the hotel's amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Paty H
Reviews.Content: You should Take a romm with a blacony because its a differnt experience, the staff was very kind and helpful, the breakfast area is across the street, not the best breakfast but u can try a lot of the cafes that are on the 5th avenue,,, the location of the hotel is amazing its close to everything i had a very nice stay and i woul definitely recommend it enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Chcanada
Reviews.Content: Service was crap, nothing is what it says or looks like on web, loud, no closets, no hair dryer, frige didnt work, towels where dirty, no coffee maker, no gym, no sleep number bed, no DVD player. Booked room with 2 double beds and ended up with one king and a cot. Worst hotel I have ever stayed at bar non

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Sammie3
Reviews.Content: At the heart of it all in PLaya! Good room servicem rooms very clean and beds so comfy!! Front desk recep there is at least 2 moodly receptionists and I could not get them to smile no matter how hard I tried. Fun place for singles or fun couples:)

Reviews.Title: “If you don't intend to party all night, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Ronit H
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that came for our honeymoon. At first, the hotel seemed nice- very modern, the room was big and clean. but the problem started around ten o'clock at night and lasted until 5AM... very loud music,from the bar on the roof of the building and afterwards from two noisy clubs just across the street - we couldn't get any sleep at all... it was a nightmare. at some point, around 2 AM, my husband called the reception and complained, so they sent someone who gave us ear plugs... we couldn't believe it! in the morning we wanted to leave and to get our money back for the second night we ordered (it is the hotel policy to charge all nights during check in). only after arguing with the stuff - we got it. so- go there only if you don't intend to sleep all night !

Reviews.Title: “A good one”
Reviews.Author: so2080
Reviews.Content: Different from all hotels in playa. Great rooms and shower. The roof pool is nice. a bit expensive, look for prices at booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Well kept, but noisy some nights.”
Reviews.Author: Kimberleyp3
Reviews.Content: The room was great, no view but very clean, tidy and affordable. The staff was so great. Had trouble with the door, some days you could just push it open even if it was locked. The clubs across the street were noisy only two nights out of seven. Not a family hotel by any means, but worked for me and my friend. Pool up top was gorgeous. Great view of the city. Close to the ocean. Near 5th ave.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel when you want to be in the centre of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: KandAM
Reviews.Content: When I first looked at the website I though this place looked a little tacky but I was wrong. It is ultra modern and very white but that said, its also stylish and extremely comfortable. The hotel beds are magnificent and the showers are warm with strong pressure (this is sometimes rare in Mexico). It is a hotel with a night life and it is very close to large clubs like coco bongos which I thought would make this place too noisy but we slept beautifully. The staff at the hotel are accommodating and friendly and I will recommend also the day spa. Karen in the spa is lovely and offers beautiful relaxing treatments. The complimentary breakfast provided at a nearby restaurant was also fantastic. The pool looked amazing but we did not have the opportunity to swim. I will say again, it is a hotel close to the party scene but it is also very comfortable and convenient to the centre of town. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER Going Back there!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerstar18
Reviews.Content: Although from pictures and first impression it looks like a nice hotel, once u actually stay there the picture u had starts to faint... First they gave us a room by the pool on the first floor, it was humid and mouldy, pillows were practically wet and it smelled like gorgonzola cheese all over, so after insisting we got another room, which was slightly better and did not smell, the AC was not the best and had to be on 24/7 in order for the room to keep a nice temp and for it not to feel humid. There's no room service in the hotel but they have a menu from a "partner" restaurant, but apparently they forgot they are partners cause once u call to order they have no idea of what are you talking about, so u might as well forget about your room service. They send you for breakfast to an external restaurant, don't go! It's the worst breakfast I've ever had!!! Oooh and also forget about sleeping, you can hear the music and screams from the clubs next to the hotel until 8:00 am, a total nightmare. The only good thing is the location, but given everything is close and you can walk everywhere in Playa, it's not a superr plus they have, and you cannot even park on that street. People at the reception were not very helpful either... I do not recommend this hotel, go somewhere else, there are many others which are much better and at the same price as this one, In fashion is definitely not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip - will return”
Reviews.Author: m5clt
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay at all inclusive. Thought we would try something different. The location is great. Within 2 easy blocks of premium restaurants, the night clubs, and the beach. We stayed in a master suite and heard no street noise - since these suites are the furthest from the road. Rooms were very clean. I usually go to cancun but now have a new preferred destination. The ADO bus is cheap transportation and very easy and to navigate. bus drops off about three safe blocks from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lovetohittheroad
Reviews.Content: Everything is within walking distance...food, shopping. My husband and I stayed in the master suite w/jacuzzi. We had some problems with it but the manager, Juan Francisco Quiñones Suárez, immediately addressed the problem to our satisfaction. The rooms and the pool were very clean. The beds were comfortable. Premium bottles of liquor stocked in the suite!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: DaniVolcov
Reviews.Content: We stayed at In Fashion from April 28th to May 3rd and it was really perfect! The location couldn't be better. You are close to the beach, pier to Cozumel, best bars, restaurants, and clubs. Even though the rooms are quiet and relaxing. The hotel is gorgeous and has a modern style. The size of the rooms are great and very confortable (Junior Suite). Only two things could be better in our stay: - check in and check out could be done much faster (took about 20 min) but as we were on vacation it wasn't a big problem. - the hotel's restaurant wasn't ready yet, so the breakfast was served in another restaurant located about 100mts from the hotel. But the food was really good. Well, we totaly recomend this beautiful, confortable and affodable hotel in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: demetria44
Reviews.Content: As the title indicates the location of this hotel was just excellent! We were able to walk right out the door and around the corner to 5th ave. and just a cpl blocks to the Beach and our fav. Beach club Zensi where we spent every day we went to the beach.Was also not to far from Walmart and the Mega store if you wanted to you could easily walk both ways without much effort.With this location we were also right down the street from Coco Bongo and a cpl other night clubs a few steps out the door,depending who you are that could be a good thing or a not so good thing,as we are day people and go to sleep typically early before the party gets started we brought with us some ear plugs as we had been aware of that fact before we went and were able to have good nights sleep each night as the beds and pillows and bedding were quite nice. The staff was very friendly and always with a friendly greeting especially the front desk staff both morning and evening,they were helpful with local tips and helped me locate a hairdryer.There was always someone at the front to open the door for you as well. The breakfast offering was quite good as well,better then we expected Ipanemas grill had a nice spread with good fresh fruit,yogurt, two kinds of Chilaquiles,different stlye eggs,cinamom french toast,breads and some sliced meats and other stuff, also included Fresh OJ and coffee or tea,My husband is Gluten,dairy and egg free and was able to have enough to eat each morning and That brings me to the other breakfast option at Tropical which the choice was either egg dish or pancakes niether of which my husband is able to eat so we had to leave which was to bad it looked like a nice place to enjoy breakfast right out in the open on 5th ave. and also this seemed to upset our waiter a little bit,Not sure if he understood that it was because of food allergies that we had to leave, something that we notice in Mexico is not a common issue with them as almost everyone we mentioned it too thought is was odd,honestly I thought it was to until personally had to deal with it and came to appreciate it probably has to do with the way the food has been processed and the addition of GMO's in many cases. We never did have any drinks in either of the bars or swam in either of the pools so could not comment about that other then the pools looked very clean and attractive we just preferred the beach for our swimming. The rooms were nice and clean and kept that way our whole stay,they even had an evening turn down service,we thought it was a little odd however that they came in and cleaned despite the "Do not Disturb" sign on the knob,oh well,not that big a deal for us just didn't leave a tip that day as we didn't expect them to come in.We also noticed that the lighting was always dim which served to make one always look a little more attractive and the the room with its art as well.The shower took a while to get warm which was o.k. just turned it on a did something else for the minutes it took to get warm also thought the dual shower heads were a good idea. We really enjoyed our stay and hope to return again in the future we like the boutique hotel experience and this was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: y0gijill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on a long weekend trip. We loved the hotel- very nice, trendy, great location, and friendly staff. The room and hotel was very clean. We had a room on the third floor facing towards the beach. I was great view. The hotel was in the heart of all the great restaurants and shops of the town. The only bad things were-AC was either too cold or not cool enough, also you could here the local clubs playing music till about 4 am. I did get a massage at the hotel- it was good, but for $40 down the road you can get a great massage too right on the beach! Overall I recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Abuelocharlie
Reviews.Content: Located between 5th & 10th avenues on 12th North this is in the heart of the action in PDC. The hotel is new enough that the shuttle driver from Cancun airport didn't know it and had to be given directions. Free Wi-Fi is available, the rooms are spartan in a modern minimalist way. They could use better lighting if you're a reader and the noise from 5th could keep a light sleeper up. But you are where everything is in Playa del Carmen. 2 pools, one on the roof and one on the 1st floor (2nd floor for Americans) are both shallow but great for cooling off in. Breakfast was included in our stay which was a full buffet at a nearby restaurant as the hotel doesn't serve food. We got our reservations through an auction site on line and paid only $60 per night.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect place to stay in Playa - highly recommended!””
Reviews.Author: mickrapa
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in Playa del Carmen.The location is fantastic with the beautiful shops, bars, cafes and restaurants at door step.The hotel has a very light contemporary interior with many artistic oil paintigs hanging in the lobby area. Our room was modern, very sleek and very clean. I am surprised to hear about others experiences of noise as it was extremely quiet during our stay. The staff was fantastic - all with excellent English, a pro-active attitude, warm and friendly . They went out of their way to help with our requests and showed a genuine interest in us without being overbearing. We had a wonderful time . Perfect place to stay - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great city in mexico”
Reviews.Author: sunyounguy
Reviews.Content: stayed there 3 days march 10th to 13th.did not want to leave.comfie rooms they are quiet if they are away from the 14th street.it located across coco bongo so it right in the night life.1 block to the beach and a step from the 5th ave. street witch is the best .i want to go back so bad but this time i will go longer for shure.it has free wi-fi, free safe and beach towels.hotel is about 2 years old and is keep clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: erickcastillo
Reviews.Content: I want to go back very soon!, great location , near to the beach and near to the party. itsthe perfect spot in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Our Babymoon At In Fashion Boutique Was Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Amy_and_Ercu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, celebrating our babymoon, just returned from a four-night stay (Thursday - Monday) at the In Fashion Boutique. We loved it! The hotel, which was impeccably clean, is like a modern art museum. The reception staff, especially Edith and Pablo, were very welcoming and quick to offer dining and beach club directions and recommendations. Although we were never disturbed by the maid service, they visited our room, made our bed, and replenished our towels twice a day. We stayed in petit room no. 205 and did not have any noise problems. We expect this should be true for all of the petit rooms because they line the inner courtyard of the hotel and do not face the street. Our room was spacious and the bed and pillows were so comfortable we checked the brand in case we wanted to purchase for our home. Our room amenities included: refrigerator (with room to keep some of your own items), iron, ironing board, 2 bottles of water, 2 glass drinking glasses, Keisi shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bar soap, comb, shoe cloth, shower cap, sewing kit, and cotton swabs. Our two-headed rain shower had consistant hot water with decent pressure. Our room could have been improved by adding a hair dryer and better lighting near the sinks. Also, when we first arrived our room was programmed for minimal air conditioning which we were unable to override with the room's thermostat . We told the front desk and within minutes the temperature was reset to a comfortable level. For $108 USD a night (including tax - booked through Orbitz.com), this is a hidden gem and a great bargain of a hotel, especially because of its proximity to the beach, shopping, and nightlife, and because it includes breakfast at your choice of two restaurants. We preferred Indigo's at 14th street and the beach (three blocks walk from the hotel). The easiest route to Indigo's is take 12th street toward the beach, take a left at the Blue Parrot, go straight until you get to 14th street, and take a right. The hotel also provides complimentary blue and white striped beach towels and a beach club pass for free chairs at Wicky's. We did not check out Wicky's but instead followed fellow travelers' recommendations and camped out at Mamita's beach club (28th street and beach). At Mamita's, we rented 2 beach chairs and an umbrella for $9 USD per day. The service here was good, crowd diverse, and swimming beach excellent. We are world travelers and generally stay at hotels ranging from $200-$400 USD per night. We believe that In Fashion Boutique is competitive with other reputable boutique hotels and, once discovered and demand increases, could easily justify higher rates. For authentic, affordable Mexican cuisine, try Carboncitos at 4th Street between 5th & 10th Avenues. For travel to/from the Cancun Airport, take the ADO bus. If you arrive at terminal three, after exiting the terminal building, take a right and walk 30 yards. An ADO bus representative sitting at a small wood podium near bus lanes 2 or 3 will sell you a ticket for $22 pesos or $2 USD a person one way. We purchased our return tickets at the same time. This ADO bus will also make a quick stop at Terminal 2 before heading to Playa Del Carmen. Do not get on the ADO bus to Cancun - it's a different bus. It's about a 30-45 min ride to Playa Del Carmen's main bus terminal at Juarez Street (the equivalent of 0 Street) & 5th Avenue. You will exit the bus and take a left onto 5th Avenue. From here, you will walk on 5th Avenue until you get to 12th Street. At 12th Street, take a left and In Fashion Hotel is mid-block on your left. For the average person with wheeled luggage, the walk is not too strenuous, but if you have a lot of luggage, you can also grab a taxi outside the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “If you wanna Party this is the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kitkle
Reviews.Content: If you are going to playa and wanna sleep and lounge during the day and party at night. This is the best place in Playa. I did not go out at all and I still loved the hotel. Stay here it is one of the est hotels in this town and I have been to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in Playa!!!...(if you travel with friends)”
Reviews.Author: any_dazs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the 12 street, where you'll find only the best nightclubs and night life in Playa del Carmen. Just two blocks away from the beach. This hotel is great if you're travelling with friends, nice design, comfortable rooms, very nice staff.... but don't think you're getting much sleep. The beds and pillows are OK, the thing is...you're in the middle of the night action, you'll hear the music from until 6 or 7am plus all the drunk people arriving to the hotel and shouting. This is perfect if you're one of them. I really recommend this hotel.... on ly if you're travelling with friends and if nightlife is what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: lurve2travel143
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from vacation. We stayed here for 5 nights. We were overall happy with our accommodations. The rooms look exactly the way they do in the pictures. The service was fantastic. They cleaned the rooms twice daily and everyone was helpful and very friendly. The dual shower heads was awesome (heat and pressure was just fine). The beds were very comfortable and they always left little candy at night. It is close to everything, two blocks from the beach, close to 5th Ave and 10th Ave (if you want cheaper foods). Complimentary breakfast at Indigo was really good. You also get free chairs at Wicky's (which I would skip and just hang out at Indigos, better chairs, etc). You also get 50% of at the GYM which is a great place to take spin, yoga, pilates classes. You do not, however, get a discount at Coco Bongo. The CONS: (1) Please skip the spa, the massage was terrible. The worst I've had ever and definitely not worth the $83 USD nor their promotions. (2) If you want quiet accommodations, this is not the place for you. Though we didn't have trouble sleeping (mostly because we were so tire of our days activities), you can definitely hear the music bumping from nearby clubs/lounges. And it only gets louder as it approaches the weekend. If it weren't for the inconvenience of changing hotels (especially when we booked online), I would have done it because I really wanted my R&R. (3) No hot tubs unless you book the spa suite. And the two pools they have are extremely cold (as are all unheated pools during this time of the year in PDC). (4) Many of the rooms do not have a window (like 1st and 2nd), some may have a balcony (it is the way the building is designed and the fact that it is in the midst of other buildings abutting it). Luckily it was not busy and we had a room with partial ocean view, no balcony. We were happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “If you like modern, Vegas style hotel in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: Mani2ban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. It is very modern, white and full of windows/light. Our window faced the ocean - no balcony. The rooftop area is wonderful for lounging and 360 views but only a dipping pool. Turn down service in the evening was a bonus. Very noisy street full of bars in front like Coco Bongo. Wouldn't recommend for families either as there's no privacy in the bathroom/shower. Beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in Mexico! Definitely good for a couple nights if you want to be in the heart of all the action and near to 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “never go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: shelley054
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the in fashion hotel for 4 nights, the first night i booked on line as i wanted to see what its all about and extend my stay only if i liked the hotel. at the first day, we checked in and were very impressed by the location and design of the hotel, and were offered a promotion by edith the girl at the front desk to have 3 nights for the price of two. we were so impressed that we upgraded to the suite, asking and confirming with edith the terms of the price. she guaranteed that this was the price and so we moved our stuff to the new suite. everyday we had a different problem with the room - the hot water in the shower took about 5 minutes until you could step in, one day the cleaning lady moved the sing in away that it wasnt connected to the pipes so all the water came out on the floor and onto our stuff, and the pool was always cold and not full till the top. then when we came to check out we were given a much higher bill then what we had agreed on with edith. luckily edith was there so she knew what we were talking about but said she could do nothing about it, it was a problem of mis-communication. i asked her to talk to the manager as i was not going to pay for something i didnt agree to, and she was the one who offered us the promotion and upgrade. when i asked to speak to the manager, fernel, she said he wasnt there, only by phone, so i spoke to him on the phone where he basically accused us of trying to cheat the hotel out of money and if we dont pay he will call the police on us (!!!), after that he said he is not willing to talk to me anymore and hung up. i was shocked that he would be so dense and thick, as i explained i am willing to pay but only what we agreed on (the differnce was about 250usd). as again they threatened to call the police on us we paid what they asked and left. i have never seen such lairs anywhere else in the world, and i have traveled and stayed both in cheap motels and in high end hotels, never happened to me before!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you are a party goer”
Reviews.Author: worldwidetraveler45
Reviews.Content: I have returned from a trip to the Fashion Hotel. I had high hopes but was sadly disappointed. If you do not intend on sleeping at night then its a great place for you, if you want to sleep at night then forget it, dont stay here! The noise was crazy, from the night clubs next doors to the roof top bar we didn't get a wink of sleep. The water in the shower took at least 10 minutes running to become bearable to get into. The water in the pool was freezing!! Also the pool has very shallow . The cleaning staff were like a gaggle of geese, just when you though you might get a bit of shut eye by the pool they were laughing , joking and being really loud as they cleaned the rooms. Seriously don't stay here if you dont like noise, it's not just noise its like trying to sleep in a night club!! Hotel looks nice but I would never go back. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stefani5
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews but this time I had to... This hotel is perfect for people who want to be close to everythng -this is the best location in Playa -right next to 5th Eve.,the beach, bars and night clubs. I have to say that althogh it's in the middle of everthing -we havn't heared any noise from the street, furthermore -I slept great since the bed and the pillos are sooo comfotable. The rooms look amazing -very fashionable, exactly like the pictures at the website. From the first moment we arrived to hotel Fernando the manager was so nice to us and did everything just to make us happy(never seen such a great attitude like this from a manger in my whole life). I have to say that the workers at the hotel are so nice and make you feel very comfortable from Daniella & Alonzo at the front desk, the house keepers and the guys from the room service... They all were so nice to us -allways smiling and checking with us that we are satisfied. Since we enjoy here we decided to extend our staying. We are deffently recomend this hotel and we shurely will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous design and service in the heart of Playa!”
Reviews.Author: leftlanne
Reviews.Content: We were booked in another hotel (with much higher Tripadvisor ratings) Feb. 11th. We found In Fashion while walking down 12th and were curious because it looked so interesting. Alehandro Del Rio greeted us and offered to show us a room. It was decorated minimally with great art and a very well laid-out bathroom. He also took us to the roof to tour the pool area. His friendliness and enthusiasm for the hotel was infectious and we decided to change hotels as soon as we could. We ended up staying at In Fashion for 6 nights and loved being there! The staff is super helpful and friendly. Our room was a standard with an ocean view, cost less than the hotel we left, and included a full breakfast. The bed was very comfortable with fabulouse linens and lots of pillows. There was a double-headed shower and 2 marble sinks in the bathroom. All the lighting is recessed and has dimmers. Not your typical hacienda look! It's on the same street with Coco Bongo and other night clubs, so we were worried it would be loud. But the rooms are so well insulated that it really wasn't a problem. The location is so good! They gave us passes for the beach club, Sensi, which included free chairs and 10% off our bill, and is only a very short walk away from the hotel. Make sure and try Sensi's Ceviche which was the best I've had in Playa. The hotel breakfast, which is included was very good. However, the service is slow, as is often typical in Playa. There is no doubt where we'll stay next year. I highly recommend this hotel and wish to thank the staff, which helped make our vacation so wonderful!
